text: <@UCGBUH5TM> thanks for sharing this. Is this something HubSpot launched or added recently as a feature. We have a download form and i remember getting a lot of invalid/fake email ids in our system like <mailto:xyz@abc.com|xyz@abc.com> etc
so just need to know if i need any 3rd party service to prevent these emails getting into our system
I think this post was from maybe a year back, but probably <@UDDJG2VFG> can help answer that
can you just clone the default form module, then make all the other amends to turn it into you’re custom module?

We're working to add to the existing HTML all that we can but we reached the end of it.
To create a fully accessible version of the form we will likely have to break with the past and offer an option to opt into that so we don't break existing template/styles.

Anyone else been running into weird Chrome issues with HS auto-resized images over the past week or so? Did they change their srcset api or something? on Retina screens some images have been showing up smaller than before
weirdest thing is if you correct it with inspector styles, then toggle those same styles back off, it stays renders as normal. suspecting it may be a chrome bug.
<@UDJV5B73R> Yeah, that will give me the code I need, but not the field I need in the custom module so that the customer can select the campaign via the drop down.

have a weird issue with related_blog_posts tag... it's pulling content from all blogs in the portal not just the current... it's supposed to be set to the default (aka current) blog if you don't pass in the blog_ids param but its not doing that...
and if i set the blog_ids param to the current blog id i get zero results... anybody experienced anything like this?
Ill take a look
can you DM me your hub id
sure here's a sample post
<https://unified3.newbreedmarketing.com/blog/uf2-oper-bleaque-ab-illo-quae/?hs_preview>
and here's the module that is pulling the related posts
<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/302335/modules/10770872591>
we use that portal for testing and it has a TON of blogs so maybe that's part of the problem
<@UFRLX48M6> this was the thread mentioning it
<@U2H3TT8F2> thanks man
no problem

not really sure where to put this, but am I correct in my thinking that blog search requests are domain specific? so if a client has their website on <http://www.domain.com|www.domain.com> and their blog on <http://blog.domain.com|blog.domain.com>, it will only show results from the domain they submit the form from? any way to get them combined into the same search?
I believe it’s portal specific
could be wrong though
you can add the domain to the search module with a query parameter
`&domain=<http://blog.domain.com|blog.domain.com>`
nice! thank you! will put this together for them and do some more testing.
thanks guys!

Apologies for the delayed response, <@U79N5J2AU>. Thanks for tagging me in, <@UCGBUH5TM>!

The validation steps outlined in this article (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-does-HubSpot-validate-email-addresses>) and expanded upon in this thread (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Inconsistent-email-validation-using-Forms-API/m-p/229191>) are not new, however the team continues to iterate on and improve their implementation.

Despite these checks, it is still very much possible for a “fake” email addresses like <mailto:xyz@abc.com|xyz@abc.com> to enter a HubSpot account if they pass checks 1-4. Due to accuracy concerns, we no longer use Strikeiron.

At this time, I’m not aware of an out-of-the-box integration which validates email addresses before they are submitted through HubSpot forms or the Forms API. One alternative may be to use HubSpot’s global form events (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Form-Email-Validation-Block-all-providers-except-one/m-p/266350>) to fire your own validation or call an external service like mailboxlayer (<https://mailboxlayer.com/>).
working on some google page speed issues and noticing some fonts being included by HubSpot, does anyone know what these are used for?

that doesn’t seem normal, or atleast not HubSpot defaults.

No idea what those fonts are for but spacesword sounds like a cool font.
